required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient-Specific Simulation Used for EVAR Procedure Rehearsal - Evaluation of Clinical Performance With and Without Prior Rehearsal
clinical_study.official_title: Patient-Specific Simulation Used for Case Rehearsal Prior to EVAR Procedure - Evaluation of Clinical Performance With and Without Prior Rehearsal Using the Procedure Rehearsal Studio. Multi-center Randomized Study

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the procedural and clinical benefits of patient specific pre-procedure rehearsal for operators with various experience levels as a tool for optimizing Endovascular Aneurysm Repair (EVAR) procedures.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 hr. after EVAR procedure starts

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective operator perceived effectiveness of prior procedure rehearsal
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 hr. after EVAR procedure starts

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 hr. after EVAR procedure starts
secondary_outcome.description: Overall contrast use (volume) Skin entry radiation dose Overall procedure time (from gaining bilateral access until the satisfactory completion of endograft deployment, excluding all adjunctive procedures such as hypogastric embolization, Iliac Percutaneous Transluminal Angioplasty (PTA)/Stenting, sheath removal and hemostasis time) Procedural blood loss - number of transfused units Arterial injury (dissection, perforation, rupture, surgical conversion, embolization, none)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 hr. after EVAR procedure rehearsal starts
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of treatment plans based on Customary (normal institutional) technique, following 3D reconstruction, and after simulation procedures.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 hr. after EVAR procedure ends
secondary_outcome.description: Number and type of used wires, catheters, stent grafts, additional stent graft components and balloons

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 3 hr. after EVAR procedure starts
secondary_outcome.description: Time to cannulate the contralateral gate with a wire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Similarity of simulation to actual case
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 3 hr. after EVAR procedure ends
secondary_outcome.description: Anatomy Anticipated devices (sizing, tools) Fluoroscopic Angulations Case complexity

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction- Subjective experience of simulation experience
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 hr. after EVAR procedure ends
secondary_outcome.description: Overall ease of use Controls Imaging Device exchanges Device performance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 30 days after the EVAR procedure
Within the first 30 days after the EVAR procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Successful endograft deployment and absence of type 1 or 3 endoleak

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 3 hr. after EVAR procedure rehearsal ends
within 30 days after the EVAR procedure
Within 30 days after the EVAR procedure

arm_group.description: Procedure/Surgery : Endovascular Aneurysm Repair with no prior procedure rehearsal
Procedure/Surgery : Endovascular Aneurysm Repair with prior procedure rehearsal

study_pop.textblock: Subjects admitted for elective endovascular AAA repair will be randomized

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. At least 18 years old
2. Elective patients planned to undergo EVAR procedures with an endograft compatible with the Simbionix PRS.
3. Computed Tomography Angiography (CTA) scan of the abdominal aorta performed as standard of care. Sufficient quality/defined protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject is below 18 years old
2. Operator cannot complete the indicated rehearsal and practice.
3. Patients requiring emergent aneurysm treatment, e.g. trauma or rupture.
4. Arterial dissection.
5. Patients with Stage 4 of chronic kidney disease (GFR<30 ml/min/m2).
6. Patient is indicated for use of snorkels, chimneys, fenestrated or branched graft devices
7. Pregnant or lactating women.
8. Off label stent graft use
